title: Basic html number input test
description: A basic html number input test.

procedures.title: Enter invalid text into the number input

steps.summary: navigate forward to the number input

steps.observe: the input should be rejected and the screen reader should have conveyed that the input was rejected.

chrome.notes: said "press up arrow" and "press down arrow"

results.notes: did not announce name of the input

chrome.output: "your favorite number, edit, spinbox, 11, to set the value use the arrow keys or type the value"
in list of form fields as "Your favorite number? edit, 11"

results.notes: Used up and down arrows.

chrome.output: Each keypress was echoed, with no indication that the input was rejected

results.notes: pass because the behavior is implied by "spinbox"

edge.output: "11, edit, spinbox"

results.notes: did not announce name when focus lands on the input

edge.output: "your favorite number, edit, spinbox, 11, to set the value use the arrow keys or type the value"
"your favorite number, edit, spinbox, 11"
in list of form fields as "Your favorite number? edit, 11"
name of key was announced
value was incremented and decremented

results.notes: Used up and down arrows.

edge.output: Each keypress was echoed, with no indication that the input was rejected

results.notes: pass because the behavior is implied by "spinbox"
announced the role and value when entering the input and did not automatically switch to forms mode.

ie.output: "your favorite number, edit, 11, type in text"
in list of form fields as "Your favorite number? edit, 11"
value was not incremented or decremented

results.notes: na because IE does not support this feature
na because IE does not support this feature
did not announce the name when focus lands on the input

firefox.output: "your favorite number, edit, spinbox, 11, to set the value use the arrow keys or type the value"
in list of form fields as "Your favorite number? edit, 11"

results.notes: each keypress was echoed and the value was changed to "two11"
Used up and down arrows.

it appears that firefox allows invalid input but marks the field as invalid instead of outright rejecting the input, but does not inform the user when they are on the field, only if they leave and return to it.

edge.output: "Your favorite number, spin button, 11, minimum zero, and maximum zero, 11."
"your favorite number, spin button, 11, minimum zero, and maximum zero, 11 selected."
"your favorite number, spin button, 11, minimum zero, and maximum zero, press space to edit,11"
name of key was announced
value was not incremented and decremented

results.notes: Used up and down arrows.

edge.output: key press was echoed but input was rejected

results.notes: pass because the behavior is implied by the "number role"

chrome.output: "your favorite number, spin button, editable, selected 11"
in list of form controls as "your favorite number?; spin button; editable; 11"

results.notes: Used up and down arrows. Value was incremented and decremented appropriately.
pass because the behavior is implied by the "spin button announcement"

edge.output: "your favorite number, spin button, editable, 11"
"your favorite number, spin button, editable, selected, 11"
"your favorite number, spin button, editable, 11"
in list of form controls as "your favorite number?; spin button; editable; 11"
name of key was announced
"blank"

results.notes: Used up and down arrows. Value was incremented and decremented appropriately.

edge.output: key press was echoed

results.notes: pass because the behavior is implied by the "spin button announcement"

firefox.output: "clickable, your favorite number, spin button has auto complete, editable, 11"
"your favorite number, spin button, has auto complete, editable, selected, 11"
"your favorite number, spin button, has auto complete, editable, selected, 11"
in list of form controls as "Your favorite number?; spin button; has auto complete editable; 11"

results.notes: Used up and down arrows.
Firefox allows invalid input to be provided, but announces the field as invalid.
A number keyboard was opened and it was not possible to switch to the default keyboard. If you enter an invalid number (something like 11+) then it announces "invalid entry".

and_chr.notes: said "10" - number kept being interpreted as a command. Instead I entered data by controlling the on-screen keyboard.

ios_saf.output: "your favorite number? 11, text field, double tap to edit."
"Your favorite number? 11, text field, double tab to edit"
Text can be entered, but VO announces the input as "invalid data" after navigating back to it

safari.output: "11, contents selected, your favorite number? incrementable edit text number field"
"11, contents selected, your favorite number? incrementable edit text number field"
"11, contents selected, your favorite number? incrementable edit text number field"
in list of form controls as "11 your favorite number? incrementable edit text number field"

results.notes: Used up and down arrows.

safari.output: invalid data could be entered, and VO announces "invalid data" when navigating back to the control

firefox.output: in list of form controls as "your favorite number?; spin button; 11"

results.notes: Used up and down arrows.

firefox.output: Invalid data could be entered, but field was also conveyed as invalid

chrome.output: role was flagged with a number

edge.output: role was activated
role was flagged with a number

history.message: Add expectation for rejected input and re-test all screen readers.
Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results. NVDA now fails to convey the value of the number input in certain circumstances.
Updated results for NVDA, JAWS, Narrator, and VoiceOver for desktop browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari).
